text.0: he in midairs expanse hath golden tresses a raging serpent like the rushing tempest.
text.1: purely refulgent knowing well the morning like honourable dames true active workers.
text.2: thy wellwinged flashes strengthen in their manner when the black bull hath bellowed round about us.
text.3: with drops that bless and seem to smile he cometh the waters fall the clouds utter their thunder.
text.4: when he comes streaming with the milk of worship conducting by directest paths of order.
text.5: aryaman mitra varuṇa parijman fill the hide full where lies the nether pressstone.
text.6: o agni thou who art the lord of wealth in kine thou son of strength.
text.7: vouchsafe to us o jātavedas high renown.
text.8: he agni kindled good and wise must be exalted in our song.
text.9: shine thou of many forms shine radiantly on us.
text.10: o agni shining of thyself by night and when the morning breaks.
text.11: burn thou whose teeth are sharp against the rākṣasas.
text.12: adorable in all our rites favour us agni with thine aid.
text.13: when the great hymn is chanted forth.
text.14: bring to us everconquering wealth wealth agni worthy of our choice.
text.16: give us o agni through thy grace wealth that supporteth all our life.
text.17: thy favour so that we may live.
text.18: o gotama desiring bliss present thy songs composed with care.
text.19: to agni of the pointed flames.
text.20: may the man fall o agni who near or afar assaileth us.
text.21: do thou increase and prosper us.
text.22: keen and swift agni thousandeyed chaseth the rākṣasas afar.
text.23: he singeth herald meet for lauds.
